page.title: 16Whitley's Village Hall
page.content: The{Village Hall}was first discussed in about 1945 but the actual building was started on 10th July 1961.Mrs.L.B offered the land, 2.334 acres in size, it cost Â£233. The purchase was in the names of Mr P.S. Edwards, Mr.J.Foster and Mr J.S Taylor as Trustees. Village committees gave donations towards the building which cost Â£3,789.8s.6\d and Â£60 for the electricity supply, of which Â£1314 was received in grant aid. In the last 4 years Â£14,500 has been spent on improvements. Organisers of many events use the Hall e.g., Dances, Playgroup, Friendly Club, Youth Club, Bowls Club, W.I., Rose Queen and Pop- mobility every week and other events throughout the year. Inside there is a stage, kitchen and two separate rooms. The wooden floor and suspended ceiling are new. There is a plaque on the wall to mark Whitley as Best Kept Village.
